title: 112_s1875
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes the composition of the commission. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to limit members to two consecutive terms on the Commission. Existing members can be reappointed for one additional term. The term dates are also adjusted. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to limit members to two consecutive terms on the Commission. Members attending less than 75 percent of meetings during a term are ineligible for reappointment. Additionally, no member can be elected as Chair for a second consecutive term. Members of the Commission on International Religious Freedom serving at the time of the Act's enactment will continue until the end of their current term under existing membership conditions. SEC. 3. APPLICATION OF ANTIDISCRIMINATION LAWS. Section 204 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include protections against various forms of employment discrimination for all employees of the Commission. The Commission shall receive funds disbursed by the Secretary of the Senate or the Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives, treating it as an employing office of the Senate or the House of Representatives. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS: Amends the International Religious Freedom Act to allocate funds for fiscal years 2012 and 2013. STANDARDS OF CONDUCT AND DISCLOSURE: Increases the financial threshold to $250,000 and changes the reference from "International Relations" to "Foreign Affairs". TERMINATION: Extends the termination date to September 30, 2013. REPORT ON EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS TO PROMOTE RELIGIOUS FREEDOM. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on the implementation of the Act and its amendments within a year. The report will review the effectiveness of US Government programs promoting international religious freedom and assess the Office on International Religious Freedom's roles and functions. The report will review the roles and relationships of various offices within the Department of State related to international religious freedom, including the Ambassador at Large position and the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom. It will also analyze the structure of the Commission in comparison to other advisory commissions.
